circumstances: The airplane crashed at the 1,800 foot level of a mountain pass, near Kodiak, Alaska. The airplane was substantially damaged and the pilot and one passenger were seriously injured and four passengers received minor injuries. At the time of the accident the pass was reported closed due to IFR weather conditions.
probable_cause: Pilot-in-command's continued VFR flight into known IFR flight conditions, resulting in a collision with rising terrain.
